results.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from Mansfield Shire
results.brief_description: ‘ACMI in the regions: stories from Mansfield Shire’ takes a look at the towns of Mansfield, Tolmie and Jamieson, located in north-eastern Victoria. Interviews with the locals provide a sense of the rich history of these towns and the lifeblood that keeps them thriving.

results.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from Lockington
results.brief_description: Interviews with residents, groups and business owners of Lockington, Shire of Campaspe. These five short documentaries look at life in Lockington from different perspectives, covering local businesses, the Lockington Living Heritage Complex, a young girl growing up in Lockington, the experiences of a group of women and the Lockington Hotel, where the locals come to meet and enjoy local music at night.
results.title_for_label: ACMI in the regions: Stories from Lockington

results.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from Indigo
results.brief_description: Nine stories centred around three towns of Indigo Shire in northern Victoria: Yackandandah, Beechworth and Rutherglen. These films cover different aspects of the life of these towns. From local businesses to burning passions, the locals reflect on what they put in and what they get out of these rural centres.

results.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from East Gippsland
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: The towns of Swifts Creek, Omeo, Lakes Entrance, Orbost, Marlo and Cape Conran are quite distinct from each other but all make up the region of East Gippsland, which lies in the south-east of Victoria. In ‘ACMI in the regions: stories from East Gippsland’, locals from each town are interviewed about their lives, their community and what makes living in these towns so special.

results.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from Bass Coast
results.brief_description: On Victoria’s south-eastern coastline, lie several scenic seaside towns. The residents of Phillip Island, San Remo, Corinella, Bass, Inverloch, Kernot and Grantville talk about how each town enriches their lives, through its distinct character and community spirit.

results.title: Acids, bases and salts. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Roger Mazur, Mel Waskin and Coronet Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemistry”.
Differing in their reaction with indicators, acids can be defined as proton acceptors using the Bronsted-Lowry theory. The Lewis theory is also explained, as well as the meaning of pH.

results.title: Acid from heaven
results.brief_description: Many years ago there was a popular song suggesting that each time it rained it rained pennies from heaven. Today’s reality is that when it rains, it rains acid from heaven. By re-enacting a case study of a person whose income was cut off as a direct result of acid rain, this presentation, composed of still photo montage, provides in laymen’s terms some basic information about this little-known form of pollution.

results.title: Acid base indicators
results.creator_credit: David W. Ridgway, University of California, Los Angeles and Wexler Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
Proton donor-acceptor theory is used to interpret the experimental behaviour of acid-base indicators. Experiments and animation show the effects on indicators of changing acidity. Equilibrium constants of four indicators are determined and the indicators arranged in order of decreasing acid strength. The competition among bases for protons is shown by mixing the indicators and showing that each changes colour at different total acidity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David W. Ridgway, University of California, Los Angeles and Wexler Film Productions

results.title: Acid
results.brief_description: Presents varying ideas about LSD as expressed by users, former users, scientists and experts. Considers the extensive research now in progress, the recent discoveries about the physiological and psychological effects, and possible therapeutic uses. Psychedelic slides by Don Snyder. Song “Acid” written by Art Ciocco, performed and arranged by Tony Luisi.
